017package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.ipt_hq;
018
019import com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx;
020import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.*;
021import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
022import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
023import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram;
024import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2;
025import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
026import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Matrix4;
027import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.NumberUtils;
028
029import java.nio.Buffer;
030
031/**
032 * A substitute for {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch} that adds an additional attribute to store an
033 * extra color's worth of channels, used to modify the intensity and chromatic channels of a color by multiplication
034 * (called the "tweak") while the primary color affects the color additively (just called the color, often drawn from
035 * {@link Palette} or generated with {@link ColorTools}). This ColorfulBatch uses the IPT (HQ) color space where
036 * SpriteBatch normally uses RGBA, which means that in the batch color, r maps to additive intensity, g maps to additive
037 * protan, b maps to additive tritan, and a maps to multiplicative alpha. Additive values cause no change when they are
038 * 0.5, but cause a sharp increase at 1.0 and a sharp decrease at 0.0. In the tweak, r maps to multiplicative intensity,
039 * g maps to multiplicative protan, b maps to multiplicative tritan, and a maps to "exponential-like" contrast. Like
040 * with the additive values, 0.5 causes no change for multiplicative values, but you can think of the existing color as
041 * being temporarily shifted down by 0.5 for each of the IPT channels, so each IPT channel's range is -0.5 to 0.5 before
042 * being multiplied by the corresponding tweak value (times 2.0, which means multiplicative tweak values less than 0.5
043 * make colors closer to grayscale and values greater than 0.5 make colors more vibrant) and then shifted back to its
044 * prior range. Contrast is a special value; 0.5 still means "no change," but lower values will make intensity changes
045 * less distinct between similar colors, while higher values will "sharpen" the changes in intensity.
046 * <br>
047 * This is different from the {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.ipt.ColorfulBatch} class in the ipt package; this
048 * class gamma-corrects colors (with a gamma of 2.0 for simplicity's sake) and uses a power of 0.43 or 1.0/0.43 for some
049 * operations internally whereas the non-HQ version doesn't use any exponentiation. The HQ is short for High Quality.
050 * <br>
051 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 12/14/2019.
052 */
053public class ColorfulBatch implements Batch {
054    public static final int SPRITE_SIZE = 24;
055    public static final String TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE = "a_tweak";
056
057    private Mesh mesh;
058
059    private final float[] vertices;
060    private int idx = 0;
061    private Texture lastTexture = null;
062    private float invTexWidth = 0, invTexHeight = 0;
063
064    private boolean drawing = false;
065
066    private final Matrix4 transformMatrix = new Matrix4();
067    private final Matrix4 projectionMatrix = new Matrix4();
068    private final Matrix4 combinedMatrix = new Matrix4();
069
070    private boolean blendingDisabled = false;
071    private int blendSrcFunc = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
072    private int blendDstFunc = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
073    private int blendSrcFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
074    private int blendDstFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
075
076    private final ShaderProgram shader;
077    private ShaderProgram customShader = null;
078    private boolean ownsShader;
079
080    protected float color = Palette.GRAY;
081    private final Color tempColor = new Color(0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 1f);
082
083    /**
084     * A constant packed float that can be assigned to this ColorfulBatch's tweak with {@link #setTweak(float)} to make
085     * all of the tweak adjustments virtually imperceptible. When this is set as the tweak, it won't change the
086     * intensity multiplier or intensity contrast, and it won't change either chromatic value multiplier.
087     */
088    public static final float TWEAK_RESET = ColorTools.ipt(0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f);
089    protected float tweak = TWEAK_RESET;
090
091    /** Number of render calls since the last {@link #begin()}. **/
092    public int renderCalls = 0;
093
094    /** Number of rendering calls, ever. Will not be reset unless set manually. **/
095    public int totalRenderCalls = 0;
096
097    /** The maximum number of sprites rendered in one batch so far. **/
098    public int maxSpritesInBatch = 0;
099
100    /** Constructs a new ColorfulBatch with a size of 1000, one buffer, and the default shader.
101     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram) */
102    public ColorfulBatch() {
103        this(1000, null);
104    }
105
106    /** Constructs a ColorfulBatch with one buffer and the default shader.
107     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram)  */
108    public ColorfulBatch(int size) {
109        this(size, null);
110    }
111
112    /** Constructs a new ColorfulBatch. Sets the projection matrix to an orthographic projection with y-axis point upwards, x-axis
113     * point to the right and the origin being in the bottom left corner of the screen. The projection will be pixel perfect with
114     * respect to the current screen resolution.
115     * <p>
116     * The defaultShader specifies the shader to use. Note that the names for uniforms for this default shader are different than
117     * the ones expect for shaders set with {@link #setShader(ShaderProgram)}. See {@link #createDefaultShader()}.
118     * @param size The max number of sprites in a single batch. Max of 16383.
119     * @param defaultShader The default shader to use. This is not owned by the ColorfulBatch and must be disposed separately. */
120    public ColorfulBatch(int size, ShaderProgram defaultShader) {
121        // 65535 is max vertex index, so 65535 / 4 vertices per sprite = 16383 sprites max.
122        if (size > 16383) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't have more than 16383 sprites per batch: " + size);
123
124        Mesh.VertexDataType vertexDataType = (Gdx.gl30 != null) ? Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexBufferObjectWithVAO : Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexArray;
125
126        mesh = new Mesh(vertexDataType, false, size * 4, size * 6,
127                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.Position, 2, ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE),
128                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE),
129                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.TextureCoordinates, 2, ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0"),
130                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE));
131
132        projectionMatrix.setToOrtho2D(0, 0, Gdx.graphics.getWidth(), Gdx.graphics.getHeight());
133
134        vertices = new float[size * SPRITE_SIZE];
135
136        int len = size * 6;
137        short[] indices = new short[len];
138        short j = 0;
139        for (int i = 0; i < len; i += 6, j += 4) {
140            indices[i] = j;
141            indices[i + 1] = (short)(j + 1);
142            indices[i + 2] = (short)(j + 2);
143            indices[i + 3] = (short)(j + 2);
144            indices[i + 4] = (short)(j + 3);
145            indices[i + 5] = j;
146        }
147        mesh.setIndices(indices);
148
149        if (defaultShader == null) {
150            shader = createDefaultShader();
151            ownsShader = true;
152        } else
153            shader = defaultShader;
154    }
155
156    /**
157     * Makes a new instance of the default ShaderProgram used for this ColorfulBatch, without any {@code #version}
158     * specified in the shader source. This expects an extra attribute (relative to a normal SpriteBatch) that is used
159     * for the tweak. You may want to set the code to prepend before you call this, as with:
160     * {@code ShaderProgram.prependVertexCode = "#version 110\n";
161     * ShaderProgram.prependFragmentCode = "#version 110\n";}
162     * The actual version can be different, and may need to be different for compatibility with some hardware.
163     * @return a new instance of the default shader used by ColorfulBatch for GL2 when no shader is specified
164     */
165    public static ShaderProgram createDefaultShader () {
166        String vertexShader = "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
167                + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
168                + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
169                + "attribute vec4 " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
170                + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
171                + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
172                + "varying vec4 v_tweak;\n"
173                + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
174                + "varying float v_lightFix;\n"
175                + "\n"
176                + "void main()\n"
177                + "{\n"
178                + "   v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
179                + "   v_color.a = v_color.a * (255.0/254.0);\n"
180                + "   v_tweak = " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
181                + "   v_tweak.a = pow(v_tweak.a * (255.0/254.0) + 0.5, 1.709);\n"
182                + "   v_lightFix = 1.0 + pow(v_tweak.a, 1.41421356);\n"
183                + "   v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
184                + "   gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
185                + "}\n";
186        String fragmentShader =
187                "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
188                        "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
189                        "precision mediump float;\n" +
190                        "#else\n" +
191                        "#define LOWP \n" +
192                        "#endif\n" +
193                        "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
194                        "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
195                        "varying LOWP vec4 v_tweak;\n" +
196                        "varying float v_lightFix;\n" +
197                        "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
198                        "const vec3 forward = vec3(0.43);\n" +
199                        "const vec3 reverse = vec3(1.0 / 0.43);\n" +
200                        "void main()\n" +
201                        "{\n" +
202                        "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
203                        "  vec3 ipt = mat3(0.40000, 4.45500, 0.80560, 0.40000, -4.8510, 0.35720, 0.20000, 0.39600, -1.1628) *" +
204                        "             pow(mat3(0.313921f, 0.151693f, 0.017753f, 0.639468f, 0.748209f, 0.109468f, 0.0465970f, 0.1000044f, 0.8729690f) \n" +
205                        "             * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
206                        "  ipt.x = clamp(pow(ipt.x, v_tweak.a) * v_lightFix * v_tweak.r + v_color.r - 0.55, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
207                        "  ipt.yz = clamp((ipt.yz * v_tweak.gb + v_color.gb - 0.5) * 2.0, -1.0, 1.0);\n" +
208                        "  ipt = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, 0.097569, -0.11388, 0.032615, 0.205226, 0.133217, -0.67689) * ipt;\n" +
209                        "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
210                        "                 mat3(5.432622, -1.10517, 0.028104, -4.67910, 2.311198, -0.19466, 0.246257, -0.20588, 1.166325) *\n" +
211                        "                 (sign(ipt) * pow(abs(ipt), reverse))," +
212                        "                 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
213                        "}";
214
215
216        ShaderProgram shader = new ShaderProgram(vertexShader, fragmentShader);
217        if (!shader.isCompiled()) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Error compiling shader: " + shader.getLog());
218        return shader;
219    }
220
221    @Override
222    public void begin () {
223        if (drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.end must be called before begin.");
224        renderCalls = 0;
225
226        Gdx.gl.glDepthMask(false);
227        if (customShader != null)
228            customShader.bind();
229        else
230            shader.bind();
231        setupMatrices();
232
233        drawing = true;
234    }
235
236    @Override
237    public void end () {
238        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before end.");
239        if (idx > 0) flush();
240        lastTexture = null;
241        drawing = false;
242
243        GL20 gl = Gdx.gl;
244        gl.glDepthMask(true);
245        if (isBlendingEnabled()) gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
246    }
247
248    @Override
249    public void setColor (Color tint) {
250        color = tint.toFloatBits();
251    }
252
253    /**
254     * Sets the color to the result of {@link ColorTools#ipt(float, float, float, float)} on the same arguments.
255     * For the IPT parameters, 0.5f is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 1.0f is a neutral
256     * value. For IPT, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
257     * @see ColorTools#ipt(float, float, float, float) 
258     * @param intensity like lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (black) to 1 (white)
259     * @param protan cool-to-warm, roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 1 (orange/red/purple)
260     * @param tritan artificial-to-natural, very roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 1 (green/yellow/orange)
261     * @param alpha opacity, from 0 to 1; multiplicative
262     */
263    @Override
264    public void setColor (float intensity, float protan, float tritan, float alpha) {
265        color = ColorTools.ipt(intensity, protan, tritan, alpha);
266    }
267
268    public void setColor (final float color) {
269        setPackedColor(color);
270    }
271
272    /**
273     * Expects an int color in the format (intensity, 8 bits), (protan, 8 bits), (tritan, 8 bits), (alpha, 7 bits),
274     * (ignored, 1 bit).
275     * @param color an int color with alpha in the least significant byte and intensity in the most significant
276     */
277    public void setIntColor(final int color) {
278        this.color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(color & -2));
279    }
280
281    /**
282     * Sets the color with the given IPT and A parameters from 0 to 255.
283     * For the IPT parameters, 127 or 128 is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 255 is a neutral
284     * value. For IPT, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
285     * @see ColorTools#ipt(float, float, float, float) 
286     * @param intensity like lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (black) to 255 (white)
287     * @param protan cool-to-warm, roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 255 (orange/red/purple)
288     * @param tritan artificial-to-natural, very roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 255 (green/yellow/orange)
289     * @param alpha opacity, from 0 to 255 (254 is equivalent, since the lowest bit is discarded); multiplicative
290     */
291    public void setIntColor(int intensity, int protan, int tritan, int alpha) {
292        color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((alpha << 24 & 0xFE000000)
293                | (tritan << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (protan << 8 & 0xFF00) | (intensity & 0xFF));
294    }
295
296    @Override
297    public void setPackedColor (final float color) {
298        this.color = color;
299    }
300
301    @Override
302    public Color getColor () {
303        final int intBits = NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(color);
304        Color color = tempColor;
305        color.r = (intBits & 0xff) / 255f;
306        color.g = ((intBits >>> 8) & 0xff) / 255f;
307        color.b = ((intBits >>> 16) & 0xff) / 255f;
308        color.a = (intBits >>> 25) / 127f;
309        return color;
310    }
311
312    @Override
313    public float getPackedColor () {
314        return color;
315    }
316
317    /**
318     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 0.5 is a neutral value that should have
319     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f)} will effectively remove the tweak.
320     * @param intensity like lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (black) to 1 (white)
321     * @param protan cool-to-warm, roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (green and red are removed) to 1 (green-ness or red-ness is emphasized)
322     * @param tritan artificial-to-natural, very roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (blue and yellow are removed) to 1 (blue-ness or yellow-ness is emphasized)
323     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes; ranges from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 1 (high contrast, sharpened look) 
324     */
325    public void setTweak (float intensity, float protan, float tritan, float contrast) {
326        tweak = ColorTools.ipt(intensity, protan, tritan, contrast);
327    }
328
329    /**
330     * Sets the tweak using a single packed IPT float.
331     * @see #setTweak(float, float, float, float)
332     * @param tweak a packed IPT float, with contrast instead of alpha
333     */
334    public void setTweak (final float tweak) {
335        this.tweak = tweak;
336    }
337    
338    public float getTweak () {
339        return tweak;
340    }
341
342    /**
343     * Takes the tweak as an int in the format: intensity (8 bits), protan (8 bits), tritan (8 bits), contrast (7 bits),
344     * (1 ignored bit at the end). An example would be 0x7820206E, which slightly darkens (with intensity 0x78, slightly
345     * below the halfway point of 0x80), significantly reduces colorfulness with protan and tritan multipliers of 0x20
346     * (closer to 0, so most colors will be almost grayscale), and slightly reduces contrast (with contrast and the
347     * ignored bit as 0x6E, which is less than the halfway point).
348     * @param tweak the tweak to use as an integer, with intensity in the most significant bits and contrast in least
349     */
350    public void setIntTweak(final int tweak) {
351        this.tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(tweak & -2));
352    }
353
354    /**
355     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 127 is a neutral value that should have
356     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (127, 127, 127, 127)} will effectively remove the tweak.
357     * @param intensity like lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (black) to 255 (white)
358     * @param protan cool-to-warm, roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (green and red are removed) to 255 (green-ness or red-ness is emphasized)
359     * @param tritan artificial-to-natural, very roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (blue and yellow are removed) to 255 (blue-ness or yellow-ness is emphasized)
360     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes; ranges from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 255 (high contrast, sharpened look) 
361     */
362    public void setIntTweak(int intensity, int protan, int tritan, int contrast) {
363        tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((contrast << 24 & 0xFE000000)
364                | (tritan << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (protan << 8 & 0xFF00) | (intensity & 0xFF));
365    }
366
367    /**
368     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float)}) and the tweak (with
369     * {@link #setTweak(float)}) at the same time.
370     * @param color the additive components and alpha, as a packed float
371     * @param tweak the multiplicative components and contrast, as a packed float
372     */
373    public void setTweakedColor(final float color, final float tweak) {
374        setColor(color);
375        setTweak(tweak);
376    }
377
378    /**
379     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float, float, float, float)}) and the tweak
380     * (with {@link #setTweak(float, float, float, float)}) at the same time.
381     * @param intensityAdd like lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (black) to 1 (white)
382     * @param protanAdd cool-to-warm, roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 1 (orange/red/purple)
383     * @param tritanAdd artificial-to-natural, very roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 1 (green/yellow/orange)
384     * @param alphaMul opacity, from 0 to 1; multiplicative
385     * @param intensityMul like lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (black) to 1 (white)
386     * @param protanMul cool-to-warm, roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 1 (orange/red/purple)
387     * @param tritanMul artificial-to-natural, very roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 1 (green/yellow/orange)
388     * @param contrast foggy-to-sharp lightness contrast; affects most other components; ranges from 0 (flat, foggy lightness) to 1 (sharp, crisp lightness)
389     */
390    public void setTweakedColor(final float intensityAdd, final float protanAdd,
391                                final float tritanAdd, final float alphaMul,
392                                final float intensityMul, final float protanMul,
393                                final float tritanMul, final float contrast) {
394        setColor(intensityAdd, protanAdd, tritanAdd, alphaMul);
395        setTweak(intensityMul, protanMul, tritanMul, contrast);
396    }
397
398    @Override
399    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height, float scaleX,
400                      float scaleY, float rotation, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
401        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
402
403        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
404
405        if (texture != lastTexture)
406            switchTexture(texture);
407        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
408            flush();
409
410        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
411        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
412        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
413        float fx = -originX;
414        float fy = -originY;
415        float fx2 = width - originX;
416        float fy2 = height - originY;
417
418        // scale
419        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
420            fx *= scaleX;
421            fy *= scaleY;
422            fx2 *= scaleX;
423            fy2 *= scaleY;
424        }
425
426        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
427        final float p1x = fx;
428        final float p1y = fy;
429        final float p2x = fx;
430        final float p2y = fy2;
431        final float p3x = fx2;
432        final float p3y = fy2;
433        final float p4x = fx2;
434        final float p4y = fy;
435
436        float x1;
437        float y1;
438        float x2;
439        float y2;
440        float x3;
441        float y3;
442        float x4;
443        float y4;
444
445        // rotate
446        if (rotation != 0) {
447            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
448            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
449
450            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
451            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
452
453            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
454            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
455
456            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
457            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
458
459            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
460            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
461        } else {
462            x1 = p1x;
463            y1 = p1y;
464
465            x2 = p2x;
466            y2 = p2y;
467
468            x3 = p3x;
469            y3 = p3y;
470
471            x4 = p4x;
472            y4 = p4y;
473        }
474
475        x1 += worldOriginX;
476        y1 += worldOriginY;
477        x2 += worldOriginX;
478        y2 += worldOriginY;
479        x3 += worldOriginX;
480        y3 += worldOriginY;
481        x4 += worldOriginX;
482        y4 += worldOriginY;
483
484        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
485        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
486        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
487        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
488
489        if (flipX) {
490            float tmp = u;
491            u = u2;
492            u2 = tmp;
493        }
494
495        if (flipY) {
496            float tmp = v;
497            v = v2;
498            v2 = tmp;
499        }
500
501        final float color = this.color;
502        final float tweak = this.tweak;
503        final int idx = this.idx;
504        vertices[idx] = x1;
505        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
506        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
507        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
508        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
509        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
510
511        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
512        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
513        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
514        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
515        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
516        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
517
518        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
519        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
520        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
521        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
522        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
523        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
524
525        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
526        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
527        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
528        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
529        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
530        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
531        this.idx = idx + 24;
532    }
533
534    @Override
535    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth,
536                      int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
537        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
538
539        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
540
541        if (texture != lastTexture)
542            switchTexture(texture);
543        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
544            flush();
545
546        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
547        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
548        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
549        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
550        final float fx2 = x + width;
551        final float fy2 = y + height;
552
553        if (flipX) {
554            float tmp = u;
555            u = u2;
556            u2 = tmp;
557        }
558
559        if (flipY) {
560            float tmp = v;
561            v = v2;
562            v2 = tmp;
563        }
564
565        final float color = this.color;
566        final float tweak = this.tweak;
567        final int idx = this.idx;
568        vertices[idx] = x;
569        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
570        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
571        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
572        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
573        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
574
575        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
576        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
577        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
578        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
579        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
580        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
581
582        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
583        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
584        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
585        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
586        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
587        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
588
589        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
590        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
591        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
592        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
593        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
594        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
595        this.idx = idx + 24;
596    }
597
598    @Override
599    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight) {
600        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
601
602        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
603
604        if (texture != lastTexture)
605            switchTexture(texture);
606        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
607            flush();
608
609        final float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
610        final float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
611        final float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
612        final float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
613        final float fx2 = x + srcWidth;
614        final float fy2 = y + srcHeight;
615
616        final float color = this.color;
617        final float tweak = this.tweak;
618        final int idx = this.idx;

621        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
622        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
623        vertices[idx + 4] = v;

629        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
630        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
631        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
632

634        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
635        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
636        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
637        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;

642        vertices[idx + 20] = color;

644        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
645        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
646        this.idx = idx + 24;
647    }

654

656            switchTexture(texture);
657        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
658            flush();

662
663        final float color = this.color;
664        final float tweak = this.tweak;
665        final int idx = this.idx;

667        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
668        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
669        vertices[idx + 3] = u;

700
701    @Override
702    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
703        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
704
705        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
706
707        if (texture != lastTexture)
708            switchTexture(texture);
709        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
710            flush();
711
712        final float fx2 = x + width;
713        final float fy2 = y + height;
714        final float u = 0;
715        final float v = 1;
716        final float u2 = 1;
717        final float v2 = 0;
718
719        final float color = this.color;
720        final float tweak = this.tweak;
721        final int idx = this.idx;
722        vertices[idx] = x;
723        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
724        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
725        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
726        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
727        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
728
729        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
730        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
731        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
732        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
733        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
734        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
735
736        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
737        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
738        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
739        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
740        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
741        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
742
743        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
744        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
745        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
746        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
747        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
748        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
749        this.idx = idx + 24;
750    }
751
752    /**
753     * This is very different from the other overloads in this class; it assumes the float array it is given is in the
754     * format libGDX uses to give to SpriteBatch, that is, in groups of 20 floats per sprite. ColorfulBatch uses 24
755     * floats per sprite, to add tweak per color, so this does some conversion.
756     * @param texture the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
757     * @param spriteVertices not the same format as {@link #vertices} in this class; should have a length that's a multiple of 20
758     * @param offset where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
759     * @param count how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (20 vertices is one sprite)
760     */
761    @Override
762    public void draw (Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
763        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
764
765        count = (count / 5) * 6;
766        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
767        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
768        if (texture != lastTexture)
769            switchTexture(texture);
770        else {
771            remainingVertices -= idx;
772            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
773                flush();
774                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
775            }
776        }
777        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
778        final float tweak = this.tweak;
779
780        ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
781        //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
782        ////new way, thanks mgsx
783        for (int s = offset, v = idx, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
784            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
785            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
786            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
787            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
788            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
789            vertices[v++] = tweak;
790        }
791        idx += copyCount;
792        count -= copyCount;
793        while (count > 0) {
794            offset += (copyCount / 6) * 5;
795            flush();
796            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
797            ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
798            //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
799            ////new way, thanks mgsx
800            for (int s = offset, v = 0, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
801                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
802                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
803                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
804                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
805                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
806                vertices[v++] = tweak;
807            }
808            idx += copyCount;
809            count -= copyCount;
810        }
811    }
812
813    /**
814     * Meant for code that uses ColorfulBatch specifically and can set an extra float (for the color tweak) per vertex,
815     * this is just like {@link #draw(Texture, float[], int, int)} when used in other Batch implementations, but expects
816     * {@code spriteVertices} to have a length that is a multiple of 24 instead of 20.
817     * @param texture the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
818     * @param spriteVertices vertices formatted as this class uses them; length should be a multiple of 24
819     * @param offset where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
820     * @param count how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (24 vertices is one sprite)
821     */
822    public void drawExactly (Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
823        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
824
825        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
826        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
827        if (texture != lastTexture)
828            switchTexture(texture);
829        else {
830            remainingVertices -= idx;
831            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
832                flush();
833                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
834            }
835        }
836        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
837
838        System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
839        idx += copyCount;
840        count -= copyCount;
841        while (count > 0) {
842            offset += copyCount;
843            flush();
844            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
845            System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
846            idx += copyCount;
847            count -= copyCount;
848        }
849    }
850
851    @Override
852    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y) {
853        draw(region, x, y, region.getRegionWidth(), region.getRegionHeight());
854    }
855
856    @Override
857    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
858        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
859
860        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
861
862        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
863        if (texture != lastTexture) {
864            switchTexture(texture);
865        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
866            flush();
867        }
868        final float fx2 = x + width;
869        final float fy2 = y + height;
870        final float u = region.getU();
871        final float v = region.getV2();
872        final float u2 = region.getU2();
873        final float v2 = region.getV();
874
875        final float color = this.color;
876        final float tweak = this.tweak;
877        final int idx = this.idx;
878        vertices[idx] = x;
879        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
880        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
881        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
882        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
883        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
884
885        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
886        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
887        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
888        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
889        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
890        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
891
892        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
893        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
894        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
895        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
896        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
897        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
898
899        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
900        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
901        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
902        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
903        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
904        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
905        this.idx = idx + 24;
906    }
907
908    @Override
909    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
910                      float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation) {
911        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
912
913        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
914
915        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
916        if (texture != lastTexture) {
917            switchTexture(texture);
918        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
919            flush();
920
921        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
922        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
923        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
924        float fx = -originX;
925        float fy = -originY;
926        float fx2 = width - originX;
927        float fy2 = height - originY;
928
929        // scale
930        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
931            fx *= scaleX;
932            fy *= scaleY;
933            fx2 *= scaleX;
934            fy2 *= scaleY;
935        }
936
937        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
938        final float p1x = fx;
939        final float p1y = fy;
940        final float p2x = fx;
941        final float p2y = fy2;
942        final float p3x = fx2;
943        final float p3y = fy2;
944        final float p4x = fx2;
945        final float p4y = fy;
946
947        float x1;
948        float y1;
949        float x2;
950        float y2;
951        float x3;
952        float y3;
953        float x4;
954        float y4;
955
956        // rotate
957        if (rotation != 0) {
958            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
959            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
960
961            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
962            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
963
964            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
965            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
966
967            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
968            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
969
970            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
971            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
972        } else {
973            x1 = p1x;
974            y1 = p1y;
975
976            x2 = p2x;
977            y2 = p2y;
978
979            x3 = p3x;
980            y3 = p3y;
981
982            x4 = p4x;
983            y4 = p4y;
984        }
985
986        x1 += worldOriginX;
987        y1 += worldOriginY;
988        x2 += worldOriginX;
989        y2 += worldOriginY;
990        x3 += worldOriginX;
991        y3 += worldOriginY;
992        x4 += worldOriginX;
993        y4 += worldOriginY;
994
995        final float u = region.getU();
996        final float v = region.getV2();
997        final float u2 = region.getU2();
998        final float v2 = region.getV();
999
1000        final float color = this.color;
1001        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1002        final int idx = this.idx;
1003        vertices[idx] = x1;
1004        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1005        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1006        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1007        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1008        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1009
1010        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1011        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1012        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1013        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1014        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1015        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1016
1017        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1018        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1019        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1020        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1021        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1022        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1023
1024        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1025        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1026        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1027        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1028        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1029        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1030        this.idx = idx + 24;
1031    }
1032
1033    @Override
1034    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
1035                      float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation, boolean clockwise) {
1036        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1037
1038        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1039
1040        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1041        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1042            switchTexture(texture);
1043        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
1044            flush();
1045
1046        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
1047        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
1048        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
1049        float fx = -originX;
1050        float fy = -originY;
1051        float fx2 = width - originX;
1052        float fy2 = height - originY;
1053
1054        // scale
1055        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
1056            fx *= scaleX;
1057            fy *= scaleY;
1058            fx2 *= scaleX;
1059            fy2 *= scaleY;
1060        }
1061
1062        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
1063        final float p1x = fx;
1064        final float p1y = fy;
1065        final float p2x = fx;
1066        final float p2y = fy2;
1067        final float p3x = fx2;
1068        final float p3y = fy2;
1069        final float p4x = fx2;
1070        final float p4y = fy;
1071
1072        float x1;
1073        float y1;
1074        float x2;
1075        float y2;
1076        float x3;
1077        float y3;
1078        float x4;
1079        float y4;
1080
1081        // rotate
1082        if (rotation != 0) {
1083            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
1084            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
1085
1086            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
1087            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
1088
1089            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
1090            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
1091
1092            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
1093            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
1094
1095            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
1096            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
1097        } else {
1098            x1 = p1x;
1099            y1 = p1y;
1100
1101            x2 = p2x;
1102            y2 = p2y;
1103
1104            x3 = p3x;
1105            y3 = p3y;
1106
1107            x4 = p4x;
1108            y4 = p4y;
1109        }
1110
1111        x1 += worldOriginX;
1112        y1 += worldOriginY;
1113        x2 += worldOriginX;
1114        y2 += worldOriginY;
1115        x3 += worldOriginX;
1116        y3 += worldOriginY;
1117        x4 += worldOriginX;
1118        y4 += worldOriginY;
1119
1120        float u1, v1, u2, v2, u3, v3, u4, v4;
1121        if (clockwise) {
1122            u1 = region.getU2();
1123            v1 = region.getV2();
1124            u2 = region.getU();
1125            v2 = region.getV2();
1126            u3 = region.getU();
1127            v3 = region.getV();
1128            u4 = region.getU2();
1129            v4 = region.getV();
1130        } else {
1131            u1 = region.getU();
1132            v1 = region.getV();
1133            u2 = region.getU2();
1134            v2 = region.getV();
1135            u3 = region.getU2();
1136            v3 = region.getV2();
1137            u4 = region.getU();
1138            v4 = region.getV2();
1139        }
1140
1141        final float color = this.color;
1142        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1143        final int idx = this.idx;
1144        vertices[idx] = x1;
1145        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1146        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1147        vertices[idx + 3] = u1;
1148        vertices[idx + 4] = v1;
1149        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1150
1151        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1152        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1153        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1154        vertices[idx + 9] = u2;
1155        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1156        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1157
1158        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1159        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1160        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1161        vertices[idx + 15] = u3;
1162        vertices[idx + 16] = v3;
1163        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1164
1165        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1166        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1167        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1168        vertices[idx + 21] = u4;
1169        vertices[idx + 22] = v4;
1170        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1171        this.idx = idx + 24;
1172    }
1173
1174    @Override
1175    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float width, float height, Affine2 transform) {
1176        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1177
1178        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1179
1180        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1181        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1182            switchTexture(texture);
1183        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
1184            flush();
1185        }
1186
1187        // construct corner points
1188        float x1 = transform.m02;
1189        float y1 = transform.m12;
1190        float x2 = transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1191        float y2 = transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1192        float x3 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1193        float y3 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1194        float x4 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m02;
1195        float y4 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m12;
1196
1197        float u = region.getU();
1198        float v = region.getV2();
1199        float u2 = region.getV2();
1200        float v2 = region.getV();
1201
1202        final float color = this.color;
1203        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1204        final int idx = this.idx;
1205        vertices[idx] = x1;
1206        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1207        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1208        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1209        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1210        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1211
1212        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1213        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1214        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1215        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1216        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1217        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1218
1219        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1220        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1221        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1222        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1223        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1224        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1225
1226        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1227        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1228        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1229        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1230        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1231        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1232        this.idx = idx + 24;
1233    }
1234
1235    @SuppressWarnings("RedundantCast") // These casts are absolutely not redundant! Java 9 changed Buffer ABI.
1236    @Override
1237    public void flush () {
1238        if (idx == 0) return;
1239
1240        renderCalls++;
1241        totalRenderCalls++;
1242        int spritesInBatch = idx / SPRITE_SIZE;
1243        if (spritesInBatch > maxSpritesInBatch) maxSpritesInBatch = spritesInBatch;
1244        int count = spritesInBatch * 6;
1245
1246        lastTexture.bind();
1247        Mesh mesh = this.mesh;
1248        mesh.setVertices(vertices, 0, idx);
1249        ((Buffer)mesh.getIndicesBuffer()).position(0);
1250        ((Buffer)mesh.getIndicesBuffer()).limit(count);
1251
1252        if (blendingDisabled) {
1253            Gdx.gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1254        } else {
1255            Gdx.gl.glEnable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1256            if (blendSrcFunc != -1) Gdx.gl.glBlendFuncSeparate(blendSrcFunc, blendDstFunc, blendSrcFuncAlpha, blendDstFuncAlpha);
1257        }
1258
1259        mesh.render(customShader != null ? customShader : shader, GL20.GL_TRIANGLES, 0, count);
1260
1261        idx = 0;
1262    }
1263
1264    @Override
1265    public void disableBlending () {
1266        if (blendingDisabled) return;
1267        flush();
1268        blendingDisabled = true;
1269    }
1270
1271    @Override
1272    public void enableBlending () {
1273        if (!blendingDisabled) return;
1274        flush();
1275        blendingDisabled = false;
1276    }
1277
1278    @Override
1279    public void setBlendFunction (int srcFunc, int dstFunc) {
1280        setBlendFunctionSeparate(srcFunc, dstFunc, srcFunc, dstFunc);
1281    }
1282
1283    @Override
1284    public void setBlendFunctionSeparate(int srcFuncColor, int dstFuncColor, int srcFuncAlpha, int dstFuncAlpha) {
1285        if (blendSrcFunc == srcFuncColor && blendDstFunc == dstFuncColor && blendSrcFuncAlpha == srcFuncAlpha && blendDstFuncAlpha == dstFuncAlpha) return;
1286        flush();
1287        blendSrcFunc = srcFuncColor;
1288        blendDstFunc = dstFuncColor;
1289        blendSrcFuncAlpha = srcFuncAlpha;
1290        blendDstFuncAlpha = dstFuncAlpha;
1291    }
1292
1293    @Override
1294    public int getBlendSrcFunc () {
1295        return blendSrcFunc;
1296    }
1297
1298    @Override
1299    public int getBlendDstFunc () {
1300        return blendDstFunc;
1301    }
1302
1303    @Override
1304    public int getBlendSrcFuncAlpha() {
1305        return blendSrcFuncAlpha;
1306    }
1307
1308    @Override
1309    public int getBlendDstFuncAlpha() {
1310        return blendDstFuncAlpha;
1311    }
1312
1313    @Override
1314    public void dispose () {
1315        mesh.dispose();
1316        if (ownsShader && shader != null) shader.dispose();
1317    }
1318
1319    @Override
1320    public Matrix4 getProjectionMatrix () {
1321        return projectionMatrix;
1322    }
1323
1324    @Override
1325    public Matrix4 getTransformMatrix () {
1326        return transformMatrix;
1327    }
1328
1329    @Override
1330    public void setProjectionMatrix (Matrix4 projection) {
1331        if (drawing) flush();
1332        projectionMatrix.set(projection);
1333        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1334    }
1335
1336    @Override
1337    public void setTransformMatrix (Matrix4 transform) {
1338        if (drawing) flush();
1339        transformMatrix.set(transform);
1340        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1341    }
1342
1343    protected void setupMatrices () {
1344        combinedMatrix.set(projectionMatrix).mul(transformMatrix);
1345        if (customShader != null) {
1346            customShader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1347            customShader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1348        } else {
1349            shader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1350            shader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1351        }
1352    }
1353
1354    protected void switchTexture (Texture texture) {
1355        flush();
1356        lastTexture = texture;
1357        invTexWidth = 1.0f / texture.getWidth();
1358        invTexHeight = 1.0f / texture.getHeight();
1359    }
1360
1361    @Override
1362    public void setShader (ShaderProgram shader) {
1363        if (drawing) {
1364            flush();
1365        }
1366        customShader = shader;
1367        if (drawing) {
1368            if (customShader != null)
1369                customShader.bind();
1370            else
1371                this.shader.bind();
1372            setupMatrices();
1373        }
1374    }
1375
1376    @Override
1377    public ShaderProgram getShader () {
1378        if (customShader == null) {
1379            return shader;
1380        }
1381        return customShader;
1382    }
1383
1384    @Override
1385    public boolean isBlendingEnabled () {
1386        return !blendingDisabled;
1387    }
1388
1389    public boolean isDrawing () {
1390        return drawing;
1391    }
1392    public static final int X1 = 0;
1393    public static final int Y1 = 1;
1394    public static final int C1 = 2;
1395    public static final int U1 = 3;
1396    public static final int V1 = 4;
1397    public static final int T1 = 5;
1398    public static final int X2 = 6;
1399    public static final int Y2 = 7;
1400    public static final int C2 = 8;
1401    public static final int U2 = 9;
1402    public static final int V2 = 10;
1403    public static final int T2 = 11;
1404    public static final int X3 = 12;
1405    public static final int Y3 = 13;
1406    public static final int C3 = 14;
1407    public static final int U3 = 15;
1408    public static final int V3 = 16;
1409    public static final int T3 = 17;
1410    public static final int X4 = 18;
1411    public static final int Y4 = 19;
1412    public static final int C4 = 20;
1413    public static final int U4 = 21;
1414    public static final int V4 = 22;
1415    public static final int T4 = 23;
1416}
